byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren and Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

abstract: Performance in Haifa, Israel, of play Parallel Time, fictional drama about prison life of Palestinian man convicted of killing Israeli soldier, draws protests outside of Al-Midan Theater, where play was staged, and triggers crackdown on theater by Israeli authorities; controversy throws survival of Al-Midan, which is Israel's largest Arab theater, into doubt and highlights growing restrictions around Palestinian artists.
lead_paragraph: The play, “Parallel Time,” explores the personal details of prison life for a Palestinian convicted of killing an Israeli soldier.

headline.main: Play Set in Israeli Prison Imperils Arab Theater
headline.print_headline: Play Set in Israeli Prison Imperils Arab Theater

snippet: The play, “Parallel Time,” explores the personal details of prison life for a Palestinian convicted of killing an Israeli soldier.
